page.title: 07Mrs. Day (cont.)
page.content: archeologist.they say that in the Second World War they used the caves to store ammunition and old paintings from old Gallerys. She told us about the White Marble Church in St. Asaph. The story goes that a man met his wife on that spot, when her coach broke down so he built a church. The blank graves in the churchyard are Canadians from Kimnel Camp next door, some say they mutinied and some say they died of the 'flu. At that Point her daughter came in and told us what there is for the young ones to do, the main thing seems to be horseriding, there is a Youht Club on a Wednesday night and between 6 and 20 people go to that.If she wants to go to a disco she has to be driven to St.Asaph. Mrs.Day thinks it is very important to drive in the area.
